p.s: The excerpt of the novel Gun Love written by Jennifer Clement, published in 2019 is about a fourteen year old girl named Pearl.
She is the first-person narrator and lives together with her mother in a 1994 Ford Mercury until her mother dies.
After this the CPSChild Protective Services takes Pearl away from the trailer park and puts her in a foster home.
There live two other children named Leo and Helen.
Helen is the youngest of them.
She is eight years old and lives since six months in this foster home.
Before she came here she lived a dot-to-dot life and got moved from one foster home to another one.
So she lived in more than 17 foster homes.
In some of them she got only cereals to eat or hard to reuse her dental floss and tea bags (l. 15).
In one of them she had to sleep on the hallway and got only one piece of toilet paper a day (l. 15).
In every home she lived on bad circumstances as explained in the upper part.
Compared to that her current situation is very good.
She has everything she needs has friends and a good surrounding.
Her location is now very good but the mental situation of Helen is really bad.
